title: AGO, Operating Plants: Energy Markets-Fossil Fuel Power Plants, Australia, 1998-2008
name: AGO, Operating Plants: Energy Markets-Fossil Fuel Power Plants, Australia, 1998-2008
description: The fossil fuel webmap contains locations of Australian fossil fuel power stations that are greater than 20MW. Each power station has such information as fuel type, technology used, size (MW), ownership, latitude and longitude and data source. Web links and site photographs are provided where possible. A download feature is provided for clients who want the base data.

properties.name: Bairnsdale
properties.comments: Plant to meet peak demand.  Extra 43MW commissioned inJan 02

properties.name: Mica Creek A,B&C
properties.reference: Electricity Australia 2001 (ESAA) p56; CSEnergy website (4/05); Media Release (25/5/06)
properties.comments: Located at Mt Isa. Converted from coal to gas 1999.  1x30MW plus 3x33MW (steam turbines), 4x35MW GT and 1x36MW plus 1x20MW waste heat turbines. In May06 AGL & CSEnergy announced a plan to expand the plant by 70 to 100MW's at a cost of $150-200M by 2010

properties.name: Quarantine
properties.reference: www.electricitynet.com.au (28/6/01);  ASX announcement 19 Dec 2001; www.minebox.com (23 April 02)
properties.comments: $80M peak load gas turbine.  Designed and built by Alstom Power Ltd.  Commissioned Dec 2001.  Approval to expand to 175MW's by converting to combined cycle

properties.name: Somerton
properties.reference: Australian Stock Exchange media release 22 Jan 03
properties.comments: The $125M peak load gas turbines were commissioned in Jan02

properties.name: Hallett
properties.reference: AGL media release (11/5/01 and 26/4/04); ASX news release (17/01/02); www.minebox.com (27/4/04)
properties.comments: 170km north of Adelaide. First 40MW commissioned Jan02. AGL is proposing to spend $100M expanding the capacity to 430MW's

properties.name: Mount Piper
properties.reference: Electricity Australia 2001 (ESAA), p55; Watts and Drops Newsletter (5/7/06)
properties.comments: 25 km W of Lithgow. In June 2006 announced that an $80M upgrade will inject an additional 180MW by 2008/09. There is space for 2 more 660MW units to be built.

properties.name: Yarra (Newport)
properties.comments: 6km SW of Melbourne; Formerly Newport D.  In Feb 03 Babcock&Brown and Prime Infrastructure purchased the Yarra (Newport) and Jeeralang power plants for $202M from AES Corp

properties.name: Alice Springs
properties.reference: Electricity Australia 2001 (ESAA), p58; NT Gov't Media Release (23/5/05)
properties.comments: Ron Goodin Power Station.  3x5.5MW diesel 1974; 2x1.9MW diesel 78; 3x4.2MW Gas/Diesel Recip 1987; 11.7MW 1988; 2x3MW diesel (8.7MW diesel on Brewer Estate - 1997). A new 10.1MW $10.5M Titan 130 generator was installed at the Ron Goodin Power Station in 2

properties.name: Anglesea
properties.comments: 35 km SW of Geelong TWE 4 Apr 98 'almost half of Point Henry's power requirement.'

properties.name: Appin Colliery
properties.comments: Methane drainage at the Appin underground black coal mine

properties.name: Argyle
properties.comments: Argyle Diamond Mine

properties.name: Barcaldine
properties.reference: Projects Q'ld, No 16 1996; Electricity Australia 2001 (ESAA) p56
properties.comments: Len Wishaw power station at Barcaldine in Central Queensland. 1x38MW GT and 1x15MW Steam Turbine

properties.name: Bayswater
properties.comments: Near Liddell Power Station.  Blending woodwaste. Macquarie Generation have committed to a 160MW upgrade.

properties.name: Bell Bay
properties.reference: Electricity Australia 1996 (ESAA), p18; Hydro Tasmania News Release (23 Dec 03)
properties.comments: The first unit was commissioned in 1971 and the second in 1974. Is capable of supplying 20% of the State's electricity needs. Converted to gas in 2003

properties.name: Berrimah
properties.comments: Darwin

properties.name: Kwinana BP Refinery
properties.reference: Aust Mining Monthly 12/96; ABC NewsOnline (23/2/05); Transfield Services websites (2/5/05)
properties.comments: 32km S of Perth. 2x39.5MW GT and 1x40MW cogeneration (uses waste gases).  76MW exported. IPM Eagle is a partnership of International Power and Mitsui

properties.name: Callide A&B
properties.comments: 110km S of Rockhampton;  Callide A: 4x30MW 1965 refurbished 1998, Callide B: 2x350MW 88/89

properties.name: Callide C
properties.comments: 110km S of Rockhampton near Biloela.  Baseload supercritical power plant consisting of 450MW completed 7/01 and the 2nd 450MW completed 11/01.  Coal sourced from the nearby Callide open-cut mine
properties.owned: CS Energy (50%) and (50%) OzGen BV (owned 50% Intergen and 50% China Huaneng Power)

properties.name: Cannington
properties.reference: www.edl.com.au; Electricity Australia 2001 (ESAA) p56; EDL ASX Release 7/2/02
properties.comments: Providing power to the BHP silver mine south of Mt Isa.  A 6MW expansion is expected to come into operation in July 2003.  Another 6MW's is due to come on line in August 2003

properties.name: Cape Lambert
properties.comments: Iron ore operations

properties.name: Channel Island
properties.comments: Darwin; 3x38.6MW CCGT 1986; 2x31.6MW GT; 1x32MW Diesel/Gas; 1x44MW Gas 2000. Proposing to add a 30-40MW gas fired generator by 2005. Depends on securing a deal with Conoco-Phillips at Wickham Point

properties.name: Collie A
properties.comments: Collie 160km S of Perth

properties.name: Collinsville
properties.reference: Queensland Power Nov 97; Electricity Australia 2001 (ESAA), p56; Transfield Services website (2/5/05)
properties.comments: 80km SW of Bowen. Refurbished 1998.  4x30MW and 1x60MW. An intermediate plant that shuts on weekends

properties.name: Corio
properties.reference: Profiting from cogeneration, DPIE, 1997; Electricity Australia 2001 (ESAA), p55
properties.comments: Shell Oil Refinery; 55% power; steam used in refinery process; 25MW 1992

properties.name: Dampier C
properties.reference: Electricity Australia 2000 (ESAA), p69; Peter Jansen, Hamersley Iron (31/12/01)
properties.comments: Iron ore operations.  Provides power to port and Tom Price, Paraburdoo, Channar, Marandoo and Brockman mines

properties.name: Dry Creek
properties.comments: 9km N of Adelaide.  Planning a 40MW GT in 2002.  Synergen Power is owned by Australian National Power which in turn is owned 100% by International Power plc
properties.owned: Synergen Power Pty Ltd (100% Australian National Power owned 100% by International Power plc)

properties.name: Eraring
properties.comments: Western side of Lake Macquarie near Newcastle

properties.name: Ernest Henry
properties.comments: Copper Mine NE of Mt Isa and north of Cloncurry (plans for transmission line from Mica Creek) av load 25MW peak 28MW

properties.name: Geraldton
properties.comments: 483km north of Perth

properties.name: Gladstone A&B
properties.reference: Profiting from cogeneration, DPIE, 1997; Electricity Australia 2001 (ESAA), p56; Electricity Australia 2004 (p50)
properties.comments: 1x15MW GT 1976 (oil fired); 6x280MW 76/82 (black coal fired); Transfield bought NRG's stake in June06

properties.name: Gove
properties.comments: Mine, town power & steam for alumina treatment. The Gove expansion is planned to increase alumina production from 2.1Mtpa to 3.3Mtpa.  It includes converting the power station to gas at a cost of $50M

properties.name: Hazelwood
properties.reference: Sydney Morning Herald (2/8/04); Electricity Australia 2001 (ESAA), p55; Vic Region NEM Review Jan03 by Burnvoir Partners
properties.comments: 153km E of Melbourne. Planned modifications to turbines and generators to achieve more efficient use of steam. Progressive changes between 2003 and 2008 to increase capacity by about 130MW
properties.owned: International Power Hazelwood (91.8% International Power and 8.2% Commonwealth Bank Group)

properties.name: Hunter Valley
properties.reference: Electricity Australia 2001 (ESAA), p55; Electricity Australia 2002 (ESAA); Electrcity Australia 2004 (p48)
properties.comments: Near Liddell Power Station

properties.name: Invicta
properties.comments: Bagasse, 35-40MW sold to grid; 9MW 1976, 2.5MW 1995, 38.5MW 1996

properties.name: Jeeralang A&B
properties.comments: 157km E of Melbourne; 4x56.5MW GT 1979, 3x80MW GT 1980.  In Feb 03 Babcock&Brown and Prime purchased the Yarra (Newport) and Jeeralang power plants for $202M

properties.name: Parkeston
properties.comments: Parkeston Power Station near Kalgoorlie

properties.name: Kalgoorlie
properties.comments: 596km E of Perth; 37MW GT, 1x25MW GT 1984/90

properties.name: Kalgoorlie Nickel Smelter
properties.comments: WMC nickel operations.
properties.owned: Southern Cross Energy (Transalta - TEX Desert Pty Ltd)

properties.name: Kambalda
properties.comments: Nickel mine
properties.owned: Southern Cross Energy (Transalta - TEX Desert Pty Ltd)

properties.name: Katherine
properties.comments: 2MW Diesel 1976, 1.7MW Diesel 1987, 3x8MW GT

properties.name: Kwinana
properties.comments: 100% power; steam used in alumina process.  5x10MW steam/gas (cogen), 1x8.5MW and 1x16MW

properties.name: Kwinana A,B&C
properties.reference: Electricity Australia 1996 (ESAA), p18; miningnews website 4 June 2002; Western Power news release 8/8/02
properties.comments: 32km S of Perth; A: 2x120MW 1970, B: 2x120MW Gas&Steam Turbine 1970, C: 2x200MW 1976;  and a 1x21MW Gas Turbine 1972.  The $270M 240MW Cockburn 1 GTCC plant to replace Kwinana B by Dec 03

properties.name: Leinster
properties.comments: Nickel mine
properties.owned: Southern Cross Energy (Transalta - TEX Desert Pty Ltd)

properties.name: Liddell
properties.reference: Electricity Australia 2001 (ESAA) p55; John.Dyson@macgen.com.au; ISR Media Release 17 May 2001; macgen website (6/6/03)
properties.comments: By 2005 planning a $52M replacement of 30 year old low pressure turbines with state of the art turbines increasing the generating capacity by at least 60MW (15MW's each).  Blending woodwaste

properties.name: Loy Yang A
properties.reference: Electricity Australia 2001 (ESAA), p55; Vic Region NEM Review Jan03 by Burnvoir Partners; AGL Media Release (8/4/04); Loy Yang Power website (19/7/08)
properties.comments: Planned upgrade between 2002-08 to increase capacity by ~236MW ($100M 80MW upgrade brought forward).  GEAC includes AGL, CBA and TEPCO purchased Loy Yang A (4/04). Base capacity of 200MW upgraded to 2160MW
properties.owned: Loy Yang Power Ltd (100% Great Energy Alliance Corporation shareholders are AGL, Tokyo Elelectric Power Co and CBA)

properties.name: Loy Yang B
properties.reference: Electricity Australia 2001 (ESAA), p55; Sydney Morning Herald (2/8/04)
properties.comments: 165km E of Melbourne.  International Power plc purchased the Edison Mission Energy stake (8/04)

properties.name: Mackay
properties.comments: Mackay

properties.comments: 445km NNE of Tennant Creek; 3x4MW GT 1995, 0.95MW Diesel 1995, 3x2.8MW GT 1995/96

properties.name: Mines Station - Mt Isa
properties.comments: Mt Isa

properties.name: Mintaro
properties.comments: 110km N of Adelaide.  Planning a 65MW GT expansion in 2002.  Synergen Power is owned by Australian National Power which in turn is owned 100% by International Power plc
properties.owned: Synergen Power Pty Ltd (100% Australian National Power owned 100% by International Power plc)

properties.name: Morwell
properties.comments: 150km E of Melbourne; 1x20MW 1958, 3x30MW 58/59, 1x60MW 1962

properties.name: Mount Keith
properties.reference: Electricity Australia 2001 (ESAA), p57; Geodynamics Press Release (4/5/05)
properties.comments: Nickel mine. Geodynamics Ltd have secured $2.08M from the Federal Government (4/5/05) to fund a 13MW Kalina cycle power plant at Mt Keith
properties.owned: Southern Cross Energy (Transalta - TEX Desert Pty Ltd)

properties.name: Newman
properties.comments: Mt Newman iron ore operations; 108MW GT 1996

properties.name: Muja A,B,C&D
properties.comments: 209km SE of Perth; A&B: 4x60MW 1965, C: 2x200MW 1981, D: 2x200MW 85/86; Stage D to be upgraded by 54MW's costing $30M in mid-2006

properties.name: Mungarra
properties.comments: 60km E of Geraldton; 2x37MW 90/91; 1x38MW 90/91

properties.name: Munmorah
properties.reference: Electricity Australia 2001 (ESAA), p55; AFR (4/6/98); Investment Monitor - Access Economics (June 2004); Australian Financial Review June 1998)
properties.comments: On Lake Munmorah, 50km S of Newcastle. Plus 2 further 300 MW units in storage from March 98. Possible $400M redevelopment within 3 to 5 years. Considered a repowering of the 30 year old plant to 1100MW gas turbine combined cycle in 1998

properties.name: Murrin Murrin
properties.reference: Energy WA April 98 p54, Who's Who in Cogeneration 1999
properties.comments: Nickel mining operation with 2x28MW and 1x20MW GTCC and a 4.8MW Diesel Backup

properties.name: Northern
properties.reference: Electricity Australia 2001 (ESAA), p56; AFR 18 June 2002; Australian Financial Review (5/6/06)
properties.comments: 5km S of Port Augusta.  $150M plan to refurbish and expand baseload capacity. In June 06 B&B purchased NRG Flinders SA assets

properties.name: Osborne
properties.reference: Profiting from cogeneration, DPIE, 1997; Electricity Australia 2001 (ESAA) p56
properties.comments: North west of Adelaide.  1x120MW and 1x60MW.  Combined Cycle Gas Turbine cogenration plant.  Steam used for electricity generation and chemical processing
properties.owned: Osborne Cogen P/L (Origin Energy and Canadian Utilities)

properties.name: Paraburdoo
properties.reference: Electricity Australia 1996 (ESAA), p18; Peter Jansen, Hamersley Iron (31/12/01); AFR (5/5/04)
properties.comments: Iron ore operations - mine and beneficiation plant. Generating plant uses distillate.  Hamersley Iron is planning to install a gas fired turbine at Paraburdoo

properties.name: Long Island Point
properties.comments: Long Island Point; Petroleum refining

properties.name: Pine Creek
properties.reference: Electricity Australia 1996 (ESAA), p19; Profiting from Cogeneration, DPIE,1997

properties.comments: 35km N of Perth; 2x35MW 1990/92, 2x110MW, 1x120MW 1996, 5x35.2MW

properties.name: Pinjarra
properties.comments: 100% power; steam used in alumina process; 40MW 1973, 35MW 1985, 20MW 1972

properties.name: Plane Creek

properties.name: Port Hedland
properties.reference: Energy Resources in WA www.energy.wa.gov.au; Electricity Australia 2001 (ESAA) p57; AFR 16/3/04
properties.comments: Iron ore operations.  Consists of 3x36MW GT 1996 and 2x36MW GT 1998

properties.name: Port Kembla
properties.comments: Integrated steel works, waste gases,natural gas,fuel oil

properties.name: Port Lincoln
properties.comments: 1x25MW GT 1998 and 1x25MW GT 2000. Synergen Power is owned by Australian National Power which in turn is owned 100% by International Power plc
properties.owned: Synergen Energy (100% Australian National Power owned 100% by International Power plc)

properties.name: Rockhampton
properties.reference: Electricity Australia 1996 (ESAA), p18 Queensland Power 8/97 p45-47
properties.comments: Rockhampton

properties.comments: Two Alstom Frame 6 gas turbines installed on the existing Roma power station site

properties.name: Smithfield
properties.comments: Paper board recycling and manufacturing; 6MW GT 1988, 112.5MW GT +48MW ST 1996

properties.name: Snuggery
properties.comments: 400km SE of Adelaide. 3x26MW GT 1978, 25MW GT/diesel 1997. Synergen Power is owned by Australian National Power which in turn is owned 100% by International Power plc
properties.owned: Synergen Power Pty Ltd (!00% Australian National Power owned 100% by International Power plc100% International Power plc)

properties.name: Stanwell
properties.comments: 28km W of Rockhampton

properties.name: Swanbank A&B
properties.reference: Electricity Australia 2001 (ESAA), p56; Weekend Australian (28-29/8/04); CS Energy website (4/05)
properties.comments: 40km W of Brisbane near Ipswich, B - 4X120MW 70/73, (A - Closed - 6x68MW 1966/69), . Swanbank A ceased operation in June 2002 after 36 years service (Tender for Sale and Removal 28/8/04)

properties.name: Tarong A&B
properties.reference: Electricity Australia 2001 (ESAA), p56;  Queensland Power May 2000; Tarong Energy website (23/3/04); Electricity Australia 2004 (p50)
properties.comments: Near Nanango, 140km NW of Brisbane. Consists of a 15MW GT oil fired (1983) and 4x350MW coal fired generators (84/86). Tarong North 450MW extension commissioned 2003

properties.name: Thomas Playford B
properties.reference: Electricity Australia 2001 (ESAA), p56; AFR 15-Jan-03); Australian Financial Review (5/6/06)
properties.comments: 5km S of Port Augusta.  Currently undergoing a $150M upgrade (by Alstrom Power) from a 210MW peaking plant to a 240MW intermediate plant (commissioned in second half of 2003). In June 2006 B&B purchased the SA assets of NRG Flinders

properties.name: Torrens Island A&B
properties.reference: AFR (22/7/04); Weekend Australian (30 May 1998); Electricity Australia 2001 (ESAA), p56; Australian Finacial Review (21/6/05)
properties.comments: 16km NW of Adelaide. Proposal to CCGT unit A4 adding 250MW. Consists of 4x120MW 1967 and 4x200MW 1977.  Singapore Power purchased asset in July 2004 from TXU (with ACCC approval)

properties.name: Tower Colliery
properties.comments: Methane drainage at the Tower underground black coal mine

properties.name: Tully
properties.reference: Profiting from cogeneration, DPIE, 1997; Electricity Australia 1999 (ESAA), p68
properties.comments: Bagasse (coal supplementary); 1.5MW 1956, 2x2.25MW 1965, 5.3MW 1975, 8.7MW 1997

properties.name: Vales Point B
properties.comments: On Lake Macquarie 35km S of Newcastle.  Blending woodwaste

properties.name: Wagerup
properties.comments: 100% power; steam used in alumina process; 39MW 1981, 25MW 1993, 34MW GT 1999

properties.name: Wallerawang C
properties.comments: 15 km W of Lithgow.  Blending woodwaste

properties.name: Weipa
properties.reference: Profiting from cogeneration, DPIE, 1997; Australian Mining 10/98
properties.comments: 750km north west of Cairns; Bauxite mine, 3x5.5MW ?, 1x4.5MW 1995

properties.name: Whyalla
properties.reference: Who's Who in Australian Cogeneration 2000; Electricity Australia 1996 (ESAA), p18
properties.comments: 60MW of various waste gas cogneration plants at the Whyalla steel works; Long Products have 37.5MW waste gas fired steam turbine. Origin Energy has 2x4.5MW natural gas fired steam turbine cogeneration

properties.name: Worsley
properties.comments: Worsley alumina refinery in SW Western Australia

properties.name: Yabulu
properties.comments: 15km NW Townsville; Nickel refinery.  3x12.5MW.  BHPBilliton are proposing a $380M expansion to the nickel refinery including increasing the capacity of the current power station

properties.name: Yabulu
properties.reference: Transfield Services website (2/5/05); www.energyreview.net (8/2/05); The Australian (5/6/02); Electricity Australia 2001 (ESAA) p56
properties.comments: 15km NW Townsville. The old 150MW A1 Jet fuelled plant was converted to a 220MW GTCC plant in 2004. CH4 provide coal bed methane gas via a 400km pipeline from near Moranbah in the Bowen Basin

properties.name: Yallourn W  A&B
properties.comments: 140km E of Melbourne; 2x350MW 73/75 and 2x375MW 81/82. China Light and Power (CLP). Produces about 22% of Victoria's electricity. In 2003 plant rerated by 30MW or 2% to 1480MW by running units faster

properties.name: Dampier
properties.comments: Pilbara

properties.name: Gladstone QA
properties.comments: Gladstone alumina refinery

properties.name: Kwinana
properties.reference: Sydney Morning Herald (2/8/04); Electricity Australia 2001 (ESAA), p57
properties.comments: A double entry - same as Powerno 74. 2x39.5MW GT and 1x40MW cogeneration.  International Power plc purchased Edison Mission Energy's stake (8/04)

properties.name: Maryvale
properties.comments: Pulp and paper mill; 3x12MW and 1x18.5MW.  Australian Paper has 2xBlack Liquor recovery boilers (renewable fuel type about 50%)

properties.name: Mt Stuart
properties.comments: Near Townsville; Uses Kerosene.  Origin Energy bought the Mt Stuart power plant for $93M on 22/1/03 (from AES Corp). 2xMitsubishi 710D Gas Turbines

properties.name: Swanbank C&D
properties.reference: Electrcity Australia 2001 (ESAA), p56; CSEnergy Website (4/05); Electricity Australia 2004 (p50)
properties.comments: 40km west of Brisbane. C - 1x26MW (Retired was oil fired) and D - 1x37MW 1999 (Oil Fired)

properties.name: Ladbroke Grove
properties.comments: Using gas from the Ladbroke Grove gas field in the Otway Basin; Planning an extra 40MW

properties.name: Phosphate Hill
properties.comments: Closed cycle 4x4.5MW GT, 1x8.5MW Steam Turbine; Open cycle 1x3.8MW & 1x4.5MW GT; Cogen 3.5MW; Diesels 3.6MW

properties.name: Kwinana 2
properties.reference: Who's who in Australian Cogeneration 2000; Electricity Australia 2001 (ESAA) p57; AFR July 7 1999 p20
properties.comments: Steam for process at Tiwest.  $23M cogeneration plant to produce 36MW electrcity and 175,000t of steam for titanium dioxide pigment plant

properties.name: Oakey
properties.reference: Electricity Australia 2001 (ESAA) p56; www.babcockbrown.com; Electricity Australia 2004 (p50)
properties.comments: 4km west Oakey (SW Queensland).  A peaking/intermediate load plant owned 50% by Babcock and Brown. 2xSiemens V94.2 Gas Turbines

properties.name: Millmerran
properties.comments: 180km SW of Brisbane. A $1.5Billion supercritical plant using 3.6Mtpa of coal from the Commodore open-cut. In Jan 04 China Huaneng Group purchased 50% of Intergen's 54% holding (through OzGen BV)
properties.owned: Millmerran Power Partners (Intergen, China Huangeng Group, Marubeni, GE Capital, EIF and Tohoku Electric

properties.name: Worsley
properties.comments: Collie 160km S of Perth (1x120MW Gas Turbine and 1x30MW)

properties.name: Pelican Point
properties.reference: Australian Financial Review 26/10/01, p21; Electricity Australia 2001 (ESAA) p56&p59
properties.comments: Near Port Adelaide. Cost $400M and was officially comissioned 25/10/01.  2x160MW CCGT/gas and 1x158MW steam/gas.  ANP are planning a 250/300MW expansion in 2004

properties.name: Redbank
properties.comments: In Hunter Valley near Singleton.  Uses waste coal tailings in a fluidised-bed plant employing 50.  Cost over $320M.  Prime Infrastructure bought 50% (23/6/03)

properties.name: Rocky Point
properties.comments: Sugar mill; $3M Showcase Grant for 30MWe cogeneration plant; Bagasse also woodwaste; Sold to JV for $5.12M (6/06)
properties.owned: National Power and Babcock and Brown JV

properties.name: Tarong North
properties.reference: Q'ld Coal Dec99; Queensland Power May 2000; Tarong Energy website (23/3/04)
properties.comments: A new 445MW advanced cycle coal fired generator. Construction commenced Jan 2000. Commissioning of the plant commenced in August 2002 and was completed in July 2003.

properties.name: Bulwer Island
properties.comments: $75M investment; Supplying heat to BP refinery; 32MW electricity & 55MW of heat

properties.name: Swanbank E
properties.comments: The $300M development was commissioned in Nov02 (start Sept 2000). It has an efficiency of about 58%. The fuel is sourced from coal seam methane at Santos' Scotia plant near Taroom

properties.name: Broome
properties.reference: www.energyreview.net (5/7/04 & 10/2/05)); Energy Developments Ltd ASX News Release (30/5/03)
properties.comments: Due for completion in April 2007. LNG transported to Broome from Karratha via truck. The West Kimberley Power Project includes Broome, Derby, Fitzroy Crossing, Halls Creek & Camballin-Looma (37.8 MW by 2006)

properties.name: Braemar
properties.reference: AFR 2/12/97; Arrow Energy Media Release (8/12/03); www.minebox.com (10/2/05); smh.com.au (27/4/05); www.energyreview.net (6/5/05)
properties.comments: 220km west Brisbane. Stage 1 consists of a $220M 3x150MW open cycle gas fired plant - due to operate Summer 06/07. Stage 2 consists of 2x160MW baseload gas turbines & a 160MW steam generator in 2008

properties.name: Kogan Creek
properties.comments: Near Chinchilla. A $1.1 billion base load super critical power station using air cooling. Includes a 2.8Mtpa coal mine, 120 permanent jobs and is expected to commence in September 2007.

properties.name: Valley Power
properties.reference: Sydney Morning Herald (2/8/04);AFR (22/7/04); Electricity Australia 2002 (ESAA), p71; Aust Stock Exchange report 8/10/01; AFR 2/8/02; www.energyreview.net (1/9/05)
properties.comments: $164M peaking plant in La Trobe Valley. On a site adjacent to Loy Yang B. Snowy Hydro paid $243M for Contact Energy, International Power & Mitsui's stakes in Valley Power

properties.name: Vales Point
properties.comments: Redirecting ventilation air from coal mines to power station

properties.name: Cockburn 1
properties.reference: AFR 16-17 Dec 2000; Delta Electricity/Access Economics Investment Monitor (March 03); Western Power website (7/8/03); www.energyreveiw.net (17//1/03)
properties.comments: A new $270M 240MW GTCC plant is being constructed to replace the old 2x120MW Kwinana B power plant.  Cockburn 2 (240MW) is planned to retire Muja A&B plants and reduce usage of Kwinna A

properties.name: German Creek
properties.reference: Qld Govt Mining & Energy Journal, Dec 2000; EDL ASX Report (5/6/03); Courier Mail (8/6/05); ASX Release (7/6/05); Media Release (9/6/06)
properties.comments: EDL developed a $43M nominal 32MW waste coal seam methane power plant at the German Creek coal mine approximately 800km NW of Brisbane.  Offers greenhouse gas abatement equivalent to 1.2Mt of CO2pa

properties.name: Lonsdale
properties.comments: 18x1.125MW diesel fuelled power station in Adelaide

properties.name: Esperance
properties.reference: Australian Financial Review (2/4/02) and Australian (12/7/02); Esperance Power Station website (6/8/03); Western Power Media Release (11 March 2004)
properties.comments: Western Power to purchase electricity from a $45M 27.5MW GT (5x5.5MW) built and operated by Burns and Roe Worley.  Replaces the current 17MW of diesel power.  Involves construction of a 330km pipeline

properties.name: Pinjarra
properties.reference: Australian and AFR 4 July 02; www.minebox.com (10/12/02); www.energyreview.net (22/12/2004); WA Prospect Magazine (June 06)
properties.comments: Development of cogeneration at Alcoa's Pinjara alumina refinery.  First $100M. Construction of a second 140MW unit commenced in early 2005 (due in late 2006)

properties.name: Wickham Point
properties.comments: The Batu-Undan oil and gas field 500km NW of Darwin.  A LNG at Wickham Point and a power plant of up to 180MW is estimated to be used

properties.name: Telfer
properties.reference: Newcrest website (4/8/03 & 16/2/05); Newcrest 2003 Annual Report (7/7/2004); Investment Community Briefing 2003
properties.comments: 3xLM600 Gas Turbines for the redeveloped Telfer Gold Mine (17Mtpa plant).  Gas pipeline from Port Hedland (450km). In past fuel supplies hindered by floods. Back-up 20MW diesel power station

properties.name: Kemerton
properties.reference: Australian Financial Review (4-5/10/03); The Australian (9/12/03) WA Prospect Bulletin Feb04; The Weekend Australian (26-27/11/05)
properties.comments: A $250M peak load power station at the Kemerton industrial park. Construction commenced in early 2004. Opened November 2005. Built by Siemens under a $250M turnkey contract. Designed to operate for 100 hours per annum

properties.name: Bluewaters 1
properties.reference: The Griffin Group website (16/7/04); www.minebox.com (2/6/05); www.minebox.com (20/12/05)
properties.comments: $400M Baseload Bluewaters Power Project construction to start early 2006. To provide electricity and steam to projects in the Coolangatta Industrial Estate 4.5km east of Collie. Located next to the Ewington 1 mine. Griffin also planning for a Bluewaters

properties.name: Bastyan
properties.comments: Proposed supplementary diesel fired generator at Bastyan Hydro Power Station.  There is a 5% probability of the generator being required in Autumn 2004.  It would cost about $12M to rent the generator

properties.name: Ravensthorpe
properties.comments: Nickel mine using an acid leach process to extract nickel concentrates for refining at Yabulu in North Queensland. GA estimated capacity of the power station

properties.name: Burrup Peninsula
properties.comments: A $630M ammonia fertiliser plant being constructed with a planned capacity of 760,000tpa

properties.name: Jabiru
properties.comments: Supplies power to the Ranger uranium mine and the township of Jabiru.  Consists of 5 diesel and one steam turbine

properties.name: Perth
properties.comments: Four mobile 20MW generators from the USA will operate from December for a 4 months leasing period as back-up. Oil fired using stockpiles Western Power has been accumulating

properties.name: Laverton North
properties.comments: A $150M peaking power station commenced construction in Oct 04 and is expected to be completed mid-2006. Located in Cherry Lane 15km west of the Melbourne CBD. To be operated remotely from Cooma.

properties.name: Daandine
properties.comments: The $27M power station will be fueled by 2.2PJ/ann of coal seam gas from the Daadine field near Dalby. Completion Dec 2006

properties.name: Kwinana
properties.comments: The WA State Cabinet approved a $400M gas fired power station at Kwinana. Construction commenced in August 2006
